channel.title: Analysis on Brian Higgins Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content in Analysis on Brian Higgins Portfolio

item.title: Analysis of Birth Data: Implications for Maternal Healthcare
item.description: Outline: This project involves a comprehensive analysis of a dataset from a maternity hospital, containing information on 250 single births, with variables like birth weight, gestational weeks, maternal age, and binary indicators for low birth weight, preterm birth, hypertension, and baby gender. The main objective is to explore the connections between birth weight and these variables. The report begins with an introduction defining the research scope, followed by descriptive statistics to characterize the data.

item.title: BrainStation:Can Social Media Affect A Share Price?
item.description: Outline: This research project delves into the intriguing question: “Can social media influence a company’s share price?” The study takes GameStop, an American video game, consumer electronics, and gaming merchandise retailer, as a case study. It aims to explore whether users on social media platforms can collectively decide to buy GameStop shares, leading to significant impacts on its stock price. This question holds real-world significance, given the vast global audience on social media platforms, surpassing 5.

item.title: GDP & Renewable Energy Relationship: A First Data Science Project
item.description: Outline: In my first data science project, I delved into the potential relationship between a country’s GDP and the proportion of its energy derived from renewable sources. This study also investigated regional disparities in renewable energy trends from 1970 to 2018. Leveraging three datasets - GDP, energy consumption, and regional information - I aimed to answer key questions regarding this nexus. The outcomes provide valuable insights into the correlation between economic growth and sustainable energy adoption, while also showcasing my early venture into the realm of data science.
